Stay, blessed ray of memory, stay,</br>Thou ling'ring beam of raptures day;</br>O!  stay thy wild enchanting smile,</br>Dear memory do, and rest awhile;</br>Where sleep thy long forsaken roses,</br>Whose ev'ry shrinking leaf exposes</br>Some blighted love, who there reposes.</br>Yet — yet — each little pulse is throbbing,</br>Each dying eye-beam yet would meet thee,</br>Each shakes his rainbow wing, and sobbing,—</br>Puts up his little lip to greet thee.

Rapt expectation lifts her flowers,</br>To catch your smile, ye coming hours!</br>And hope escapes, all wild and free,</br>And hangs around fu-tu-ri-ty.</br>Her dancing garlands rich and bright,</br>Her wreathes of visionary light,</br>Of woven sunshine snatch'd from thee,</br>Cold — heartless — star-eyed mem-o-ry!</br>All nature wakes with love and glee,</br>And promises — fe-li-ci-ty.

Come dreamer! — clad in mimick light,</br>Wear robes of azure dropp'd with light,</br>Like beams on ocean's breast,</br>When starry tears bestrew the main,</br>And liquid lustre lights that plain,</br>Where silence holds her breathless reign,</br>While day-light sinks to rest.</br>When far beneath the wave we see</br>That cool — that deep tran-quil-li-ty,</br>Which none but wa'try mirrors show,</br>When not a ripple shakes the glow</br>Of fancy's sleeping world below.</br>When ev'ry drooping breeze that sweeps,</br>Its vapoury plume across it — weeps;</br>Ah!  then what glorious sights ye see!</br>What busy flashing wars awake!</br>Thy steady worlds — e-ter-ni-ty</br>Their everlasting orbits break—</br>And rise — and struggle — and subside,</br>Thus shaken in reflections tide.

Oh!  mem'ry, I remember well,</br>When frolick tun'd her flutt'ring shell,</br>And wak'd my boyhood's lips to try</br>The icy kiss of ap-a-thy:</br>I met that kiss, its chill has gone,</br>But I am desolate — alone.</br>'Twas midnight, all the winds were hush'd.</br>The tempest's startled wing had rush'd,</br>In clouds across the sky;</br>Hope toss'd her plumes, and kindly brush'd</br>The tear that to my eye-lid rush'd;</br>My love herself was nigh.</br>Oh!  memory, what a night was there—</br>'Twas cold and still — but bright and fair;</br>A spirit sat beside me.

An angel form that seem'd to say</br>"With thee forever I will stay,</br>Whatever may betide thee."</br>'Twas such a lovely night as this,</br>But colder far, and brighter,</br>Our lips first met — that icy bliss—</br>'Twas like the north wind's hasty kiss,</br>But quicker — keener — lighter.</br>Away, distracting visions!  leave me—</br>Such pictures — ah, they only grieve me.

And yet one moment memory stay,</br>And smile again that misty ray</br>That sadden'd last upon my sight—</br>That wat'ry lustre shining cold,</br>And chill, and faint, hath often told</br>My mounting heart — that all thy light</br>Was but the cheerless beam of night.

My web of life seem'd once of flame,</br>So thick were starry joys strew'd o'er it;</br>But with'ring disappointment came</br>And stole the glowing robe, and wore it;</br>She sprinkled o'er its texture, care,</br>And clouds and woe — and scatter'd there,</br>The doubtful shadows of despair.</br>Yet still — thou dear bewitching dream!</br>The bright spots flash'd a brighter gleam—</br>And hopes, that seem'd but joys in light,</br>Seem'd extacies amid that that night—</br>No more, dear memory — it is strange,</br>That thou should'st lead me such a range.</br>I felt the beam of thy bright eye</br>Falling so soft, so — si-lent-ly,</br>It seem'd like inspiration's spark—</br>'Tis gone — it perish'd in the dark,</br>And only leaves a deeper gloom,</br>Like flint-fire waken'd in a tomb,</br>Could this be fleeting mem'ries glance,</br>That led my heart this wild'ring dance?</br>It flash'd across my lonely breast,</br>A beam on ice — it froze to rest.</br>I thought some little warmth I felt,</br>But 'twas not vital — could not melt,</br>'Twas like that cold, unlovely beam</br>That lights some wintry mountain stream,</br>That shines across the trav'llers way,</br>And smiles to lure his feet astray.</br>Its glow but flash'd — a feverish light</br>To settle in a deeper night.</br>Like the warm hectic of the skies,</br>That blushes — burns — and faints — and dies.</br>
